    3.Time-Heatmap-GO

    Time-Heatmap-GO.Rmd

    1. Load TrendCatcher R package.

    library(TrendCatcher)

    2. Now read the demo master.list.

    demo.master.list.path<-system.file("extdata", "BrainMasterList.rda", package = "TrendCatcher")
load(demo.master.list.path)

    3. Use GO enrichment analysis to construct Time-Heatmap

    To draw Time-Heatmap using GO database, please use draw_TimeHeatmap_GO function. This function will return a list composed of a TimeHeatmap plot and a merge.df dataframe. Due to the limited size of Time-Heatmap for visualization, users can play with merge.df which includes all the GO enrichment analysis for each time window.

    ## Processing up-regulated genes for time window  0h-6h 
## Processing up-regulated genes for time window  6h-24h 
## Processing up-regulated genes for time window  24h-48h 
## Processing up-regulated genes for time window  48h-72h 
## Processing up-regulated genes for time window  72h-168h 
## Processing up-regulated pathways for time window  0h-6h 
## Processing up-regulated pathways for time window  6h-24h 
## Processing up-regulated pathways for time window  24h-48h 
## Processing up-regulated pathways for time window  48h-72h 
## Processing up-regulated pathways for time window  72h-168h 
## Processing down-regulated genes for time window  0h-6h 
## Processing down-regulated genes for time window  6h-24h 
## Processing down-regulated genes for time window  24h-48h 
## Processing down-regulated genes for time window  48h-72h 
## Processing down-regulated genes for time window  72h-168h 
## Processing down-regulated pathways for time window  0h-6h 
## Processing down-regulated pathways for time window  6h-24h 
## Processing down-regulated pathways for time window  24h-48h 
## Processing down-regulated pathways for time window  48h-72h 
## Processing down-regulated pathways for time window  72h-168h 
## Identified 50 GO terms for Time Heatmap.

    The full version of GO enrichment output.

    GO.time.df$merge.df[1:5, 1:5]
    ##                          ID                              Description
## 0h-6h.GO:0009617 GO:0009617                    response to bacterium
## 0h-6h.GO:0045087 GO:0045087                   innate immune response
## 0h-6h.GO:0031347 GO:0031347           regulation of defense response
## 0h-6h.GO:0019221 GO:0019221      cytokine-mediated signaling pathway
## 0h-6h.GO:0002237 GO:0002237 response to molecule of bacterial origin
##                      p.adjust GeneRatio   BgRatio
## 0h-6h.GO:0009617 6.902686e-51   106/569 444/14565
## 0h-6h.GO:0045087 1.111327e-48   106/569 469/14565

## 0h-6h.GO:0019221 4.847339e-30    64/569 265/14565
## 0h-6h.GO:0002237 6.369956e-29    59/569 232/14565

    4. Look at Genes candidates from picked enriched GO terms.

    To look at which genes are involved within the TimeHeatmap above. We can call draw_GOHeatmap function. This function is useful when one is comparing multiple projects.

    go.terms<-c("regulation of defense response", "leukocyte migration", "myeloid leukocyte migration", "leukocyte chemotaxis",
 "granulocyte chemotaxis", "cellular response to chemokine", "chemokine-mediated signaling pathway", "angiogenesis", "sprouting angiogenesis",  "respone to bacterium", "leukocyte mediated immunity")
gene.GO.df<-draw_GOHeatmap(master.list = master.list, time.window = "0h-6h", go.terms = go.terms, id.ensembl = TRUE, merge.df = GO.time.df$merge.df, 
                           logFC.thres = 2)

    The data.frame gene.GO.df contains all the genes we found through TrendCatcher without logFC threshold.

    • type, activation pathway or deactivation pathway.
    • Description, GO term.
    • gene, gene symbol or gene ensembl.
    • logFC.prev.bk, logFC compared to previous break point.
    • prev.bk.t, previous break poin time.
    • Symbol, gene symbol.
    • description, gene description.
    head(gene.GO.df)
    ##          type  Description               gene logFC.prev.bk prev.bk.t  Symbol
## 1  Activation angiogenesis ENSMUSG00000000555      2.019269         0   Itga5
## 5  Activation angiogenesis ENSMUSG00000002289      3.469766         0 Angptl4
